blocks.value: St. Philomena is known as the "Wonder Worker" because of the many miracles attributed to her intercession. Little is historically known about her life, but according to tradition revealed through visions, she was a young Greek princess who consecrated her virginity to God. She was martyred during the reign of the Roman Emperor Diocletian around the age of 13.

Her relics were discovered in the catacombs of Priscilla in Rome in 1802. Many miracles followed the discovery of her remains. St. John Vianney (the Cur√© of Ars) had a great devotion to St. Philomena and credited her intercession for many miracles in his parish.
